snippet: The number of claims deemed eligible for compensation has more than doubled since the automaker began recalling cars with faulty ignitions.
abstract: General Motors reports that the number of wrongful death claims linked to defective ignition switch has more than doubled from original estimate; twenty-seven such claims have now been deemed eligible for payment.
lead_paragraph: The number of claims deemed eligible for compensation has more than doubled since the automaker began recalling cars with faulty ignitions.

headline.main: Death Toll Linked to G.M. Defect Reaches 27
headline.print_headline: Death Claims in G.M. Recall More Than Double Estimate
